abilitygroupdescription.p: Theurgic magic is magic channelled from a powerful deity. They involve the use of the characters magic pool and are only available to certain archetypes.

abilitydescription.p: If successful those observing the character will be struck by their holiness and devoutness. This will grant a +Level bonus to Negotiate actions or Charm spells.
Demons and undead monsters will need to make an optional Mettle Check DDC 10+Level or become Enraged and Charge the caster.

Augury involves petitioning a deity or powerful being for information or insight. Auguries are performed by interpretation of the stars, palmistry, tea leaf reading, dream interpretation, use of cards, the entrails of a sacrificial victim etc. The character should choose one method per message deity and use that method thereafter.
The augury process follows the following steps. First, the character asks a question, then they prepare the augury, and finally they examine the auspicies for the answer.

When asking the question it is important that the augure specify to whom they are directing their question otherwise nameless eavesdroppers may respond. Asking the question is usually done in one of the old languages. Firstly because it may be easier to communicate to the entity in that language, and second because it makes for good theatre.

The steps to prepare an augury depend on the method of divination, but could include making a cup of tea, or sacrificing someone on an alter. The Gods are more likely to answer the character if a method appropriate to the God is used.

Finally, the auspices can be examined. The GM will answer the characters question in a three words or less or provide no response. If the augury is unsuccessful those words may have nothing to do with the question being asked. The check is made as an hidden opposed check modified by how likely it is for the god to know the answer and the likelihood that the god cares enough to answer. At higher ranks the character may be gifted visions as a response.
It is important to know that in Malleus Deum the Gods are capricious, are not omniscient or in general, particularly caring. So they may not answer the characters augury.

A character may keep making checks and asking questions until they fail, at which point they feel they have lost the attention of the god and no more attempts may be made to contact that deity for next day.

ability.abilitytitle: Back! Thou Creature From the Abyss

abilitydescription.p: The character calls on their deity to repel demons.

Renders all weapons so blessed as magical for the next ten minutes (granting them the magic tag). Grants +rank damage for these weapons against demons and the undead during that time. In the event of overcharge the weapons will glow with radiant light. The spell effects rank+1 weapons that can be seen by the caster.

If successful the character creates a vial of holy water. The deity that cleric follows cannot be evil. The character usually carries a number of vials of holy water upon their person. When required they may make an ability check. If successful they are carrying two vials, if unsuccessful they are carrying one. A boon add one to the number of vials carried, a bane reduces the number of vials carried by one. So the character may be carrying from zero to three vials. Note that the character must have down time before they can make this check again. They can't just produce a never ending stream of holy water vials. Also note that the character must have access to vials and water to create holy water. They cannot produce water in the desert.
Holy water should be kept in a special font. If kept in a vial it lasts one week.
When struck the character may check and if successful make an immediate counter-attack. On overcharge the character is Enraged.
The character can cast this spell to purge evil spirits from a possessed person or a location such as a burial site, or demon temple.

When purifying a person or an area the difficulty of the check is determined by the GM based on how evil the site is. This works as follows: first the character commits, but does not roll, at least three dice to the purification, then the GM reveals the difficulty of the check to the player, at this point the caster may choose to add additional dice to their check. Then the character rolls the magic check as usual.
If called upon Mithras will grant a +Level bonus to the caster to hit rolls and damage.

After a missle is fired and it would have missed. The caster uses his powers to try to guide a missile to its target. This spell does not work on bullets, which fly so fast the character has no time to react.

The healing character places their hands on a bloodied target and makes a check. If successful the bloodied character heals 1d6+Level Health. On overcharge the healer accidentaly uses their own animus in order to heal the bloodied character and loses d6 hitpoints.
The character creates a bright divine light attached to some object. The light burns for an hour. It is as bright as a pitch torch.

Once per day the caster may attempt the Litany of Redemption. This is a five minute ritual where the caster quotes passages from the Book of Light and reflects on the lessons within. If successful participants refresh a mettle dice if able.

The character implores their patron to take them in the stead of some other individual Near Death. If the character succeeds, up to 2d6 Health (or the targets maximum health whichever is smaller) is added to the targets health and removed from the casters Health. In the event of an overcharge the caster loses remaining health and enters the Near Death state themselves.

The character can casts this spell to purify food or water that has gone rancid, rotten, is poisoned, or is brackish. The caster can purify enough food for three people for a day per rank of the spell. Most deities will not take kindly to being continuously hassled because a follower cannot be bothered to organize provisions. In such cases the caster may lose favour with their god.

Theirgic lore is the study of how to cast theological, or clerical, spells. There is a separate ability called Theology that represents study of the the deities, the history of religion, and of the teleolical origins of the world. In most cases both abilities are required to cast theurgic spells.

The character calls on their deity to keep beings animated by necrotic forces at bay. Successfully casting this spell will cause the undead to make a DC 20 Mettle check or be held, stopping them from advancing towards, or attacking the character or their allies for three rounds. On overcharge the caster is transfixed by the spell, and unable to move for its duration. The caster may end the spell at any time after the turn they cast the spell. This spell will work on any number of undead at a time.

The character calls on their deity to repel beings animated by necrotic forces. Successfully casting this spell will cause the undead to make a DC 20 Mettle check or be turned, forcing them to retreat away from the character or their allies for three rounds. On overcharge the caster is transfixed by the spell, and unable to move for its duration. The caster may end the spell at any time after the turn they cast the spell. This spell will work on any number of the same type of undead at one time.

The character calls on their deity to destroy beings animated by necrotic forces. Successfully casting this spell will cause the undead to make a DC 20 Mettle check or be destroyed, forcing them to retreat away from the character or be destroyed. On overcharge the caster is transfixed by the spell, and unable to move for its duration. The caster may end the spell at any time after the turn they cast the spell. This spell will work on any number of the same type of undead at one time.
The character calls on their patron for support in the hour of their death! If the characters health is less than 10 they can use the Witness Me! ability to gain three melee attacks in that round.
